item.dc:creator: @Zero_Freeze ZeroFreeze
item.description:
@Zero_Freeze wrote:

cows1471:

Its just supposed to be a template >.> of course its not supposed to be great.

“hey, my name is andrew gower and I am writing RSC. please ignore the fact that it is horribly programmed and designed - after all, it’s just supposed to be an mmorpg >.> of course it’s not supposed to be great.”

Terrible logic. Why don’t you learn to accept criticism?

Edit: After reviewing your code I must say that I believe this is not worthy of posting; it’s terrible. You need to learn xhtml and css from the grounds up.

 <td height="183" colspan="3" bordercolor="#FFFFFF"><p><span class="style4"><img src="../../../My Documents/Thenoddingdog/pvp_worlds.gif" width="225" height="155" align="right" /></span></p>

You do not use such directory paths…

<table width="1054" height="1183" border="1">
Bad practice.

The design looks incomplete, empty and extremely boring - it’s merely a table. You should also avoid hardcoding design-related attributes.
Furthermore, you need to learn to structure your projects properly.

cows1471:

10 mins whipped it together.

Why did you include that? It’s completely irrelevant how long it took someone to create a good design.
(The good part does not apply here.)
If you do not give two shits about your work then why, tell me, why do you even bother posting this here? I’m pretty safe by assuming that absolutely nobody here enjoys viewing horribly designed, improperly structured, badly programmed and incomplete website designs.

Read full topic
